etymologies: Old English strǣt, of West Germanic origin, from late Latin strāta (via) ‘paved (way)’, feminine past participle of sternere ‘lay down’

definitions: a public road in a city or town, typically with houses and buildings on one or both sides

examples.text: the narrow, winding streets of Greenwich Village

shortDefinitions: public road in city or town

definitions: used to refer to the financial markets and activities on Wall Street.
shortDefinitions: used to refer to financial markets and activities on Wall Street

definitions: the roads or public areas of a city or town

examples.text: every week, fans stop me in the street

shortDefinitions: roads or public areas of city or town

definitions: relating to the outlook, values, or lifestyle of those young people who are perceived as composing a fashionable urban subculture
shortDefinitions: of outlook, values, or lifestyle of those young people who are perceived as composing fashionable urban subculture

examples.text: he ministered to street people in storefront missions

definitions: performing or being performed on the street
shortDefinitions: performing or being performed on street
